GitHub Repositories

The GitHub Training team releases many of its training repos into the public domain. The most requested, along with some highly recommended ones are listed here.

  • github/teach.github.com

    The open source teaching materials site for GitHub and Git technologies.

  • defunkt/hub

    Whether you are beginner or an experienced contributor to open-source, hub is a command-line wrapper that teaches Git about GitHub. Hub makes it easier to fetch repositories, navigate project pages, fork repos and even submit pull requests, all from the command-line.

  • robbyrussell/oh-my-zsh

    A community-driven framework for managing your zsh configuration. Includes optional plugins for a number of things, including Git, and GitHub related projects like Hub.

GitHub Help

GitHub’s help website is an excellent resource to keep bookmarked. It covers a range of Git topics from basic setup, all the way through to advanced topics.
